Questions.QuestionText:
Calculate

  1. Pinch pleated valance, outside mount with 4" returns
  2. Window: 60" wide x 48" long with 6" trim added to the window size
  3. 8 ft ceiling
  4. Hang 6" above the top window trim on an I beam
  5. Length to cover 3" of window glass
  6. Plain fabric with no repeat
  7. Lining needed?

What are the steps to complete the calculations for this window treatment?
Questions.AnswerText:
Draw ½" scale drawing on graph paper as your working copy.

  1. Outside mount means the valance has to come past the side width by 2" on each side.
  2. Window width = 4" return + 2" past + 6" trim + 60" window + 6" trim + 2" past + 4" return = 84" of space needed.
  3. Finished width needed does not include returns because they go back from the front of the treatment. Finished width = 2" past + 6" trim + 60" window = 6" trim + 2" past = finished width of treatment 76" with 4" returns (84" - 4" - 4" returns = 76")
  4. Pleated header treatment is 2 ½" fullness to pleat the treatment to cover this area.
  5. 84" x 2.5 fullness = 210" + 6" selvage edge finishing (as valace is sewn together as 1 panel = 216" fabric width.
  6. Since fabric is 54" wide, you need to see how many cuts of 54" fabric you need to allow 216" of width.
  7. 216" divided by 54" = 4 cuts. You need 4 pieces (no need to round up as the amount = full cut) of 54" fabric to sew together to make the width needed for this treatment.

Length

  1. Hung 6" abo e the trim: 18" from glass to ceiling - 6" trim = 12" of wall space.
  2. Hange 6" above the trim = 12" wall space - 6" above to hang = 6" left to ceiling. Therefore, hange 6" below ceiling.
  3. Length to cover 3" of glass from 6" above the top trim.
  4. Add 6" above trim + 6" trim + 3" past = 15" finished length.
  5. This is not the amount to order. Pleated style needs 16" to make hem and header.
  6. 15" + 16" = 31" of fabric length x 4 cuts = 124" on fabric to order = ivide by 36" = 3.4 yars of fabric. Round up to 3 ½ or 3 frac34; yards to order.
  7. Since there is no patter, order the same amount of lining.
